name: Handmade Liquid Bastille Soap - See Links at Left for Product Description
description:
New Handmade Liquid Bastille Soaps - Handmade Liquid Soaps mad with the glycerin method. While not a castile liquid soap which has only one type of oil (usually olive) This is a Bastille Soap made with 80% Olive oil along with Coconut and Castor oils to boost lather!!

We make our natural liquid soap from scratch with the same care & ingredients as we make our bar soaps. Rich in skin loving olive oil, just a bit on a bath sponge will give you loads of creamy bubbles that will leave your skin clean and moisturized, never dry.  Excellent for hand soap and body wash, Scented & colored with cosmetic grade fragrance oils, and colorants.

Fragrances to choose from are:

Pink Sugar - Sweet and Sassy

Peach Ginger - Juicy Georgia Peach with a Hint of Spice

Chardonnay & Vanilla - Sweet Muscatine Grapes harmonized with Silky Rich Vanilla

Cool Citrus Basil - Refreshing Citrus with a Hint of Basil

Poseidon - Deep & Mysterious cool and damp -- a masculine mix of aquatics, with herbal tones and leather. 

Enchantment - Fresh & fruity citrus fragrance with top-notes of grapefruit, apple, strawberries & clementine, a middle-note of peach, black currant and rose petals & a sweet white musky base note.

name: Meditation & Relaxation Line- See Page Links at Left for Descriptions
description:
Handmade Soaps using only the finest skin-loving oils, butters, essential and fragrance oils, made the "Old Fashioned Way".  I use the cold process method of soap making. All my soap is made in small batches and left to cure for 4-6 weeks, ensuring a good, hard bar that will last you a long time, when stored correctly.  For best results, handcrafted soaps should be stored out of standing water, preferably in a slotted or draining soap dish.

If you have never tried hand made soap before, you really need to give it a try.  You will never go back to buying commercial soap again.  Commercial "soap" is loaded with detergents and surfactants, and in the end what you are getting is less a bar of soap and more of a bar of chemicals.  Do you really want that all over your body?  My soaps are super moisturizing with a great lather, and I use a bar from each batch myself before making it available for purchase, as well as pH testing with high quality short-range pH paper.
